definition: Zou Taofen (1895-1944), journalist, political theorist and publisher
surname Zou/vassal state during the Zhou Dynasty (1046-256 BC) in the southeast of Shandong Province
bow case or scabbard/to hide/military strategy
to exert oneself (bound form)

sentences.english: Zhou Tao-fen was one of the greatest publisher in the present-day.
sentences.chinese: 邹韬奋是我国近代最伟大的出版家之一。

sentences.english: Zou Taofen. Reading the collected works of him, I have gotten a lot.
sentences.chinese: 重读有关邹韬奋先生的文集，感触很多。

sentences.english: This year is the 110th anniversary of the birth of Mr.
sentences.chinese: 今年是邹韬奋先生诞辰110周年。

definition: Mao Dun (1896-1981), Chinese novelist
Shao Piaoping (1884-1926), pioneer of journalism and founder of newspaper Beijing Press 京報|京报, executed in 1926 by warlord Zhang Zuolin 張作霖|张作霖
Li Gongpu (-1946), communist killed by Guomindang in Kunming in 1946
Liang Shuming (1893-1988), modern philosopher and teacher in the neo-Confucian tradition
Lu Xun (1881-1936), one of the earliest and best-known modern Chinese writers
Li Dazhao (1889-1927), early Chinese Marxist and founding member of the communist party
Zhang Shizhao (1881-1973), revolutionary journalist in Shanghai, then established writer
Wu Yuzhang (1878-1966), writer, educator and communist politician
Cai Yuanpei (1868-1940), liberal educationalist, studied in Germany, president of Peking University 1917-19, minister of education for Guomindang
Ba Jin (1904-2005), novelist, author of the trilogy 家, 春, 秋

Zhou Zuoren (1885-1967), brother of Lu Xun 魯迅|鲁迅, academic in Japanese and Greek studies, briefly imprisoned after the war as Japanese collaborator, persecuted and died of unknown causes during the Cultural Revolution
Xu Dishan (1893-1941), journalist, publisher and novelist
Hu Shi (1891-1962), original proponent of writing in colloquial Chinese 白話文|白话文[bai2 hua4 wen2]

Qu Qiubai (1899-1935), politician, Soviet expert of the Chinese communists at time of Soviet influence, publisher and Russian translator, captured and executed by Guomindang at the time of the Long March
Ye Shengtao (1894-1988), writer and editor, known esp. for children's books
Wen Yiduo (1899-1946), poet and patriotic fighter, executed by Guomindang in Kunming
